task.title: Creating a Workflow Using Advanced Mode

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Advanced workflow creation covering prerequisites, advanced configuration and conditional approvals.

ul.li: The role of the logged in user has permission to create or edit workflows.

context.p: The following procedure describes the steps to create a sample workflow using Workflow Management advanced activities. You can also use simple mode activities to create the workflow. For information on simple mode activities, refer to Creating a Workflow Using Simple Mode.
The example illustrates the following activities:

ul.li: Get Form Data – The Get Form Data action item enables you to associate a form and its field information to the workflow. Based on the field data of the form, the business decisions can be defined.
Condition Block – The Condition Block action item enables you to define conditions to the workflow.
Set Stake Holders – The Set Stake Holders action item enables you to define the stakeholders for the workflow to obtain appropriate business decisions.
If the amount entered in the Amount in $ field of the Project Fund Transaction form is more than $1000, then the transaction must be approved by the Finance Administrator.
If the entered amount in the Amount in $ field of the Project Fund Transaction form is less than $1000, then the approval of the Finance Administrator is not required.

step.cmd: To create a workflow using advanced features, in the toolbar, click Switch to Advanced.
step.info: The ADVANCED ACTIVITIES section is added to the Actions pane, and the Expressions tab is added to the canvas.

step.cmd: You can define a form parameter to the workflow that can be used as a condition in the Conditions Block action item. To add a form parameter to the workflow, perform the following steps:

substep.cmd: In the Actions navigation pane, expand ADVANCED ACTIVITIES, and then drag the Get Form Data action item to the Workflow tab.
substep.info: The new stage item is displayed on the canvas.

substep.cmd: In the Workflow tab, click the Get Form Data item.
substep.info: The Get Form Data properties are displayed in the right pane, as illustrated in the following image: Workflow Get Form Data

substep.cmd: In the Get Form Data properties pane, provide the required information in the fields, as described in the following table:

row.entry: Enter the name for the action. For example, enter Get Fund Data.

Select the required form. For example, select the Project Fund Transaction form.
Available options are forms that are defined in the application. Based on the selected form, the associated field information of the form is displayed in the Output tab.

Click the required option:
Click Any user completes action to specify that if any of the action stakeholders transition the record to the next workflow stage, the record moves to the next workflow stage.
Click All user(s) complete action to specify that all the action stakeholders must transition the record to the next workflow stage for the record to move to the next workflow stage.

To select the workflow parameters, and perform the following steps:
Click List .
The RESOURCES dialog box is displayed.
Click Workflow Data.
From the drop-down list, select Associated Form instance, and then click Save.
Available options are parameters used to define the workflow for a form.

Select the required field information check box.
The selected field information is used to create a condition for the workflow. For example, select Amount.
Available field information are associated with the form selected in the Available Forms field.

step.cmd: You can define a condition for the selected form parameter using the conditions block. To add a Condition Block action item to the workflow, perform the following steps:

substep.cmd: In the Actions pane, expand ADVANCED ACTIVITIES, and then drag the Advanced Conditions action item to the Workflow tab.
substep.info: The Advanced Conditions Block item is displayed on the canvas.

substep.cmd: In the Workflow tab, click Advanced Conditions Block item.
In the right pane, click Add Condition.
substep.info: Alternatively, right-click the Advanced Conditions Block item in the canvas, and then click New If Else Branch.

The If Else Branch is displayed below the conditions block item as illustrated in the following image: Workflow Advanced If Else Branch
To delete an If Else Branch, right-click the If Else Branch item, and then click Delete.

substep.cmd: In the Workflow tab, click the If Else Branch item.
substep.info: The If Else Branch properties are displayed in the right pane.

substep.cmd: In the Name box, enter the name for the condition.
substep.info: For example, enter Amount Greater than 1000.

substep.cmd: In the Workflow tab, click the Conditions Block item.
In the right pane, click Add Condition.
substep.info: Alternatively, right-click the Conditions Block item in the canvas, and then click New If Else Branch.
The If Else Branch is displayed below the Amount Greater than 1000 item as illustrated in the following image: Advanced Condition Block Example

substep.cmd: In the Workflow tab, click the If Else Branch item.
substep.info: The If Else Branch properties are displayed in the right pane.

substep.cmd: In the Name box, enter the name for the condition.
substep.info: For example, enter Else.

step.cmd: You can associate a stakeholder who can perform the next workflow action based on the condition defined in the condition block. To add a stakeholder to the workflow, perform the following steps:

substep.cmd: In the Actions pane, expand ADVANCED ACTIVITIES, and then drag the Set Stake Holders action item to the Workflow tab.
substep.info: The Set Stake Holders action item is displayed on the canvas.

substep.cmd: In the Workflow tab, click the Set Stake Holders item.
substep.info: The Set Stake Holders properties are displayed in the right pane, as illustrated in the following image: Stake Holders Settings

substep.cmd: In the Name box, enter the name for the action.
substep.info: For example, enter Finance Administrator.

substep.cmd: In the Perform Operation After section, click the required option:

ul.li: Any user completes action: To specify that if any of the action stakeholders transition the record to the next workflow stage, the record moves to the next workflow stage.
All user(s) complete action: To specify that all the action stakeholders must transition the record to the next workflow stage for the record to move to the next workflow stage.

step.cmd: To connect workflow items to complete the business process, click the port at the item, and drag the port to the port of the required item as illustrated in the following image:

info.note: By default, the port is located on the right of the box. To change the location of the port, right-click the new action item and click Reverse Port.

step.cmd: To define conditions on the users performing a workflow action, perform the following steps:

substep.cmd: Click the required port.
substep.info: The Workflow Connection action is displayed on the right pane.

substep.cmd: In the Perform Operation After section, click the required option:

ul.li: Any user completes action: To specify that if any of the action stakeholders transition the record to the next workflow stage, the record moves to the next workflow stage.
All user(s) complete action: To specify that all the action stakeholders must transition the record to the next workflow stage for the record to move to the next workflow stage.

step.cmd: Click the Expressions tab to define expressions for the workflows.
step.info: An expression is a programming language. It is a combination of one or more constants, variables, functions, and operators that the programming language understands and computes to produce another value.

step.cmd: To create expression for the Conditions Block action item, in the Expressions tab, perform the following steps:

substep.cmd: In the Expressions in this workflow section, click Add.
substep.info: The Create Expression dialog box is displayed. Creating Expression in Workflow

substep.cmd: In the Display Name box, the default expression name is displayed as AStringExpression.
substep.info: Enter a new name for the expression being created. For example, enter Check Amount.

substep.cmd: From the Output Data Type drop-down list, select the data type for the expression.
substep.info: For example, select Boolean.

substep.cmd: In the Description box, enter the description for the expression.
In the Expression Tree section, click RootNode.
In the Resource Parameters section, double-click the required default expression code for the Amount in $ field that is with the Instance ID.
substep.info: The default expression code is displayed in the Expression Text box as illustrated in the following image: Creating Expression Text

substep.cmd: In the Expression Text box, click and add the condition to the default expression code.
substep.info: For example, edit the default expression code, according to the format illustrated in the following image: Expression Text

substep.cmd: Click Apply.
Click Validate to check the format and completeness of the edited expression.
substep.info: On successful validation, the validation success message is displayed.

substep.cmd: Click Save.
substep.info: The Check Amount expression is added to the Expressions in this workflow section.

You can use the following example expression codes to change the condition for the workflow:
Operator Expression Description
== return [(_NewTest_GetFundData_amount)] == 1000; If the amount entered in the Amount in $ field of the Project Fund Transaction form is EQUAL to $1000, then the transaction must be approved by the Director of Finance.
!= return [(_NewTest_GetFundData_amount)] != 1000; If the amount entered in the Amount in $ field of the Project Fund Transaction form is NOT EQUAL to $1000, then the transaction must be approved by the Director of Finance.
< return [(_NewTest_GetFundData_amount)] < 1000; If the amount entered in the Amount in $ field of the Project Fund Transaction form is LESS THAN $1000, then the transaction must be approved by the Director of Finance.
<= return [(_NewTest_GetFundData_amount)] <= 1000; If the amount entered in the Amount in $ field of the Project Fund Transaction form is LESS THAN OR EQUAL to $1000, then the transaction must be approved by the Director of Finance.
>= return [(_NewTest_GetFundData_amount)] >= 1000; If the amount entered in the Amount in $ field of the Project Fund Transaction form IS MORE THAN OR EQUAL to $1000, then the transaction must be approved by the Director of Finance.
&& return [(_NewTest_GetFundData_amount)] >= 1000 && [(_NewTest_GetFundData_amount)] <= 10000; If the amount entered in the Amount in $ field of the Project Fund Transaction form is MORE THAN OR EQUAL to $1000 AND LESS THAN OR EQUAL to $10000, then the transaction must be approved by the Director of Finance.
|| return [(_NewTest_GetFundData_amount)] <= 1000 || [(_NewTest_GetFundData_amount)] >= 10000; If the amount entered in the Amount in $ field of the Project Fund Transaction form is LESS THAN OR EQUAL to $1000 OR MORE THAN OR EQUAL to $10000, then the transaction must be approved by the Director of Finance.

step.cmd: To create expression for the Set Stake Holder action item, in the Expressions tab, perform the following steps:

substep.cmd: In the Expressions in this workflow section, click Add.
substep.info: The Create Expression dialog box is displayed.

substep.cmd: In the Display Name box, the default expression name is displayed as AStringExpression.
substep.info: Enter a new name for the expression being created. For example, enter Stakeholder Finance.

substep.cmd: From the Output Data Type drop-down list, select the data type for the expression output. For example, select Text.
In the Description box, enter the description for the expression.
In the Expression Tree section, click RootNode.
substep.info: The Expression Text box is displayed as illustrated in the following image: Expression Code

substep.cmd: In the Expression Text box, enter the expression code for the stakeholder.
substep.info: For example, enter the expression code, according to the format illustrated in the following image: Validating Expression

substep.cmd: Click Apply.
Click Validate to check the format and completeness of the entered code. On successful validation, the validation success message is displayed.
Click Save.
substep.info: The Stakeholder Finance expression is added to the Expressions in this workflow section.

substep.cmd: Click the Workflow tab.

step.cmd: To add the Expression to the Amount Greater than 1000 action item, perform the following steps:

substep.cmd: In the Workflow tab, click the Amount Greater than 1000 action item.
substep.info: The Amount Greater than 1000 item properties are displayed in the right pane.

substep.cmd: In the Condition box, click List .
substep.info: The RESOURCES dialog box is displayed.

substep.cmd: Click Expression.
From the drop-down list, select the Check Amount.
substep.info: Available options are expressions defined in the Expressions tab.

substep.cmd: Click Save.

step.cmd: To add the Expression to the Finance Administrator action item, perform the following steps:

substep.cmd: In the Workflow tab, click the Finance Administrator action item.
substep.info: The Finance Administrator item properties are displayed in the right pane.

substep.cmd: In the Action Stake Holders box, click List .
substep.info: The RESOURCES dialog box is displayed.

substep.cmd: Click Expression.
From the drop-down list, select the Stakeholder Finance.
substep.info: Available options are expressions defined in the Expressions tab.

substep.cmd: Click Save.
In the View Stake Holders box, click List .
substep.info: The RESOURCES dialog box is displayed.

substep.cmd: Click Expression.
From the drop-down list, select the Stakeholder Finance.
substep.info: Available options are expressions defined in the Expressions tab.
Optionally, you can create expressions to add a different view stakeholder.

substep.cmd: Click Save.

step.info: The workflow is saved and listed on the WORKFLOW LIST page.

taskbody.postreq: The workflow must now be published to be made available in the application. For information on publishing a workflow, refer to Publishing a Workflow.
